item.title: Baltimore bridge crash brings scrutiny to contaminated fuel, an 'open secret' in shipping
item.dc:creator: Rich Schapiro and Jon Schuppe and Susan Carroll and Stella Kim and Rae Wang and Dawn Liu and Julia Jester
item.description: The cause of the Dali cargo ship's crash into the Key Bridge in Baltimore is not yet known, but it has focused attention on the problem of contaminated fuel.

media:content.media:text: Image: Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge Collapses After Being Struck By Cargo Ship
media:content.media:description: The Dali ran into the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, Md., causing it to collapse.

item.title: Biden's latest campaign strategy: Get under Trump's skin
item.dc:creator: Mike Memoli and Monica Alba and Jake Traylor
item.description: Biden is turning to personal, biting and often sarcastic attacks against Trump in public and in private, including at a major New York City fundraiser.

media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden at a fundraising event at Radio City Music Hall on Thursday.

item.title: Sacre bleu! Camembert and brie 'on the verge of extinction,' French scientists warn
item.dc:creator: Josh Lederman and Briony Sowden
item.description: Camembert and Brie could disappear, scientists in France are warning, owing to a decline of strains of fungus that give them their unique tastes and textures.

media:content.media:credit: Andrew B. Myers for NBC News
media:content.media:text: A wheel of cheese shaped gravestone in a cemetery on a hill, engraved with "Brie."
A Normandy cow that provides milk for Camembert cheese at a farm near Isigny Sainte-Mere; a cheesemaker in Camembert.
media:content.media:description: A Normandy cow that provides milk for Camembert cheese at a farm near Isigny Sainte-Mere; a cheesemaker in Camembert.

media:content.media:text: Camembert cheeses are packed into boxes at the Isigny Sainte
media:content.media:description: Camembert cheeses are packaged at the Isigny Saint-Mere company in Normandy, France.

media:content.media:text: A statue of Marie Harel, born in 1761, invented camembert cheese; cars along the Tour de France route advertise Coeur de Lion camembert cheese in 2002.
media:content.media:description: Marie Harel, born in 1761, invented Camembert cheese; cars along the Tour de France advertise Coeur de Lion Camembert.

item.title: Trump, co-defendants ask appeals court to consider booting DA Fani Willis from Georgia case
item.dc:creator: Blayne Alexander and Charlie Gile and Dareh Gregorian
item.description: Lawyers for former President Donald Trump and eight of his co-defendants in the Georgia election interference case on Friday asked a state appeals court to allow them to challenge a recent ruling that didn't disqualify Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis from prosecuting the case.

media:content.media:description: Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis at a hearing in Atlanta on March 1.

item.title: 'Spinning and whirling': Strange fish behavior sparks emergency government response
item.dc:creator: Jason Abbruzzese and Marissa Parra and Maria Piñero and Lora Kolodny, CNBC
item.description: An endangered fish found off the coast of Florida is exhibiting strange behavior, including "spinning and whirling." The government is mounting an emergency response.

media:content.media:description: This image provided by NOAA shows a smalltooth sawfish. Endangered smalltooth sawfish, marine creatures virtually unchanged for millions of years, are exhibiting erratic spinning behavior and dying in unusual numbers in Florida waters. Federal and state wildlife agencies are beginning an effort to rescue and rehabilitate sawfish to find out why.

media:content.media:text: SeaWorld Orlando senior aquarist Becki Orze points out the male smalltooth sawfish that fathered three baby smalltooth sawfish who were born at SeaWorld Orlando in Orlando, Fla on Oct. 17, 2023.
media:content.media:description: SeaWorld Orlando senior aquarist Becki Orze points out a male smalltooth sawfish that fathered three baby smalltooth sawfish in Orlando, Florida, on Oct. 17, 2023.

item.title: The end to Israel's subsidy for ultra-Orthodox who don't serve in army could imperil Netanyahu
item.dc:creator: Chantal Da Silva and The Associated Press
item.description: Israel’s Supreme Court on Thursday ordered an end to government subsidies for many ultra-Orthodox men who do not serve in the army — a blockbuster ruling that could have far-reaching consequences for the government and the tens of thousands of religious men who refuse to take part in mandatory military service.

media:content.media:description: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish men stand in front of pictures of Israeli hostages held in Gaza, at the Western Wall in Jerusalem on Jan. 10, 2024.

item.title: Nurse charged in the deaths of 17 patients bullied diabetic man before his death, suit says
item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang and Rebecca Cohen
item.description: The family of a severely diabetic man whom authorities said died at the hands of a nurse overseeing his care last year has filed a wrongful death suit against the facility where he lived, alleging it allowed the nurse to berate and bully him, and ultimately cause his death.

media:content.media:description: An insulin shot.

media:content.media:text: Sunnyview Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Butler County, PA
media:content.media:description: Sunnyview Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Butler County, Pa.

item.title: Texas appeals court blocks state from probing transgender kids' parents
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: A Texas appeals court has upheld a lower court’s injunction blocking the state from investigating parents who provide their trans children with gender-affirming medical treatments, which Gov. Greg Abbott has called abusive.

media:content.media:description: The Texas state flag flies outside the State Capitol in Austin, Texas, in 2021.

item.title: Beyoncé fans hope her new album brings more visibility to Black country artists
item.dc:creator: Daysia Tolentino
item.description: The Beyhive is busting out its cowboy hats and breaking out in line dances for Beyoncé's Cowboy Carter album.

media:content.media:text: Beyoncé, wearing a cowboy hat, smiles at the Grammy Awards
media:content.media:description: Beyoncé at the Grammy Awards in Los Angeles on Feb. 4, 2024.

item.title: Top CIA cybersecurity official speaks out on election interference, TikTok and passwords
item.description: NBC News' Courtney Kube interviews Juliane Gallina, the CIA's Deputy Director for Digital Innovation, on her biggest cybersecurity concerns.

media:content.media:title: Top CIA cybersecurity official speaks out on election interference, TikTok and passwords
media:content.media:description: NBC News' Courtney Kube interviews Juliane Gallina, the CIA's Deputy Director for Digital Innovation, on her biggest cybersecurity concerns.

item.title: U.S. business leaders meet with China’s president as Beijing seeks closer ties
item.description: NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing, where a number of U.S. business leaders, including the CEOs of Blackstone, Qualcomm, Bloomberg, Chubb and FedEx, met with the Chinese president

media:content.media:title: U.S. business leaders meet with China’s president as Beijing seeks closer ties
media:content.media:description: NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports from Beijing, where a number of U.S. business leaders, including the CEOs of Blackstone, Qualcomm, Bloomberg, Chubb and FedEx, met with the Chinese president

item.title: Radio Free Asia closes Hong Kong bureau, citing security law concerns
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Jett and Abigail Williams
item.description: Radio Free Asia is withdrawing from Hong Kong, the U.S.-funded media outlet said, citing rising concerns about press freedom in the Chinese territory.

media:content.media:description: A man waving the Chinese flag in Hong Kong on July 1, 2022, to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the former British colony’s return to Chinese rule.

media:content.media:text: Hong Kong Protests Against China's Proposed Security Law
media:content.media:description: Pro-democracy supporters scuffling with riot police in Hong Kong in 2020.

item.title: Trump shares video with image depicting Biden tied up in the back of a pickup truck
item.dc:creator: Megan Lebowitz
item.description: Former President Donald Trump shared a video on social media Friday that included an image of President Joe Biden bound and restrained in the back of a pickup truck.

media:content.media:description: Former President Donald Trump in Harrisburg, Pa., on Feb. 9.

item.title: 7 hurt after Newark-bound United flight experiences turbulence
item.dc:creator: Phil Helsel and TJ Swigart and Jay Blackman
item.description: Seven people were hurt, none seriously, after a United Airlines plane headed to a New York City-area airport experienced high winds and turbulence, officials said.

media:content.media:description: A United Plane after landing due to turbulence at New York Stewart International Airport in Orange County, N.Y., on March 29, 2024.

item.title: N.C. State upsets Marquette in the Sweet 16 to keep March Madness run alive
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: DJ Horne scored 19 points and North Carolina State kept its magical NCAA Tournament run alive, beating Marquette 67-58 on Friday night to reach the Elite Eight for the first time since 1986.

media:content.media:description: Kam Woods #2 of the North Carolina State Wolfpack celebrates after his team defeated the Marquette Golden Eagles in Dallas on Friday.

item.title: California man convicted in mother's death arrested for probation violation in Mexican beach town
item.dc:creator: Dennis Romero and Cristian Santana
item.description: A California man convicted in the death of his mother was the subject of an "intense manhunt" and arrested in Mexico after walking away from a transitional facility without notice, authorities said this week.

media:content.media:description: Aerial view of people at the beach in Playas de Rosarito, Baja California State, Mexico, in 2020.

item.dc:creator: Marlene Lenthang and Rebecca Cohen
item.description: The family of a severely diabetic man whom authorities said died at the hands of a nurse overseeing his care last year has filed a wrongful death suit against the facility where he lived, alleging it allowed the nurse to berate and bully him, and ultimately cause his death.

media:content.media:description: This image provided by NOAA shows a smalltooth sawfish. Endangered smalltooth sawfish, marine creatures virtually unchanged for millions of years, are exhibiting erratic spinning behavior and dying in unusual numbers in Florida waters. item.title: Family of Mississippi teen who died after being run over by police search for answers and accountability
item.dc:creator: Antonio Planas and Madelyn Urabe and Toby Lyles and The Associated Press
item.description: The heartbroken mother of a Mississippi teen who died after he was run over by a police cruiser last week is mourning the milestones she'll never get to see her only son achieve.

media:content.media:description: Kadarius Smith.
Kadarius Smith.

item.title: Texas appeals court blocks state from probing transgender kids' parents
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: A Texas appeals court has upheld a lower court’s injunction blocking the state from investigating parents who provide their trans children with gender-affirming medical treatments, which Gov. Greg Abbott has called abusive.

media:content.media:description: The Texas state flag flies outside the State Capitol in Austin, Texas, in 2021.

item.title: Minnesota baseball team sticking with 'Ozempig' as its mascot despite complaints that name is hurtful, insensitive
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: For a Minnesota minor league baseball team known for a history of outlandish promotions, the idea of naming its longtime live pig mascot after the weight loss drug Ozempic made perfect sense.

media:content.media:credit: St. Paul Saints Baseball via AP
media:content.media:text: Ozempig pig St. Paul Saints mascot
media:content.media:description: A pig named Ozempig at a farm in Wis., on Thursday.

item.title: César Chávez's family demands RFK Jr. stop using images of the iconic labor leader in his campaign
item.dc:creator: Vaughn Hillyard and Katherine Koretski
item.description: The family of César Chávez wants independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to stop referencing the late labor and civil rights leader on the campaign trail.

media:content.media:text: Kennedy Welcomes Nicole Shanahan as His Running Mate
media:content.media:description: Independent presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr. during an event in Oakland, Calif., on Tuesday.
American labor leader and co-founder of the United Farm Workers (formerly known as the National Farm Workers Association) César Chávez speaks at a rally in Coachella, Calif. in 1977.

item.title: Why Biden is dialing up his mockery of Trump: From the Politics Desk
item.dc:creator: The Politics Desk
item.description: Biden is dialing up his mockery of Trump on the campaign trail and making direct appeals to Nikki Haley's supporters for the 2024 election.

media:content.media:text: Former President Barack Obama claps for President Joe Biden during a fundraising event at Radio City Music Hall in New York City on March 28, 2024.
media:content.media:description: Former President Barack Obama claps for President Joe Biden during a fundraising event Thursday at Radio City Music Hall in New York City.

item.title: Texas woman acquitted of voter fraud in high profile case says it's her 'duty' to continue voting rights advocacy
item.dc:creator: Kyla Guilfoil and Megan Lebowitz
item.description: The Texas woman whose five-year sentence for voter fraud was thrown out by an appeals court Thursday said she plans to strengthen her efforts to promote voting rights.

media:content.media:description: Crystal Mason at Tim Curry Justice Center in Fort Worth, Texas in 2018.
